document.docAuthor: BOND, JASON E. & PLATNICK, NORMAN I.
document.masterDocTitle: A Taxonomic Review of the Trapdoor Spider Genus Myrmekiaphila (Araneae, Mygalomorphae, Cyrtaucheniidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Taxonomic Review of the Trapdoor Spider Genus Myrmekiaphila (Araneae, Mygalomorphae, Cyrtaucheniidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Myrmekiaphila comstocki
Bishop and Crosby, 1926
: 168,169 (male holotype from Austin , Travis Co. , Texas , in AMNH, examined).

DIAGNOSIS: Males can be distinguished by the unbranched palpal bulb with the embolus lacking a prominent distal tooth (fig. 25), the robust palpal tibia (figs. 5, 44–46, not as slender as that of
M. foliata
), and by having metatarsal dilation of leg I less prominent than in other species (figs. 15, 41–43). Female
M. comstocki
and
M. foliata
specimens are difficult to distinguish on the basis of subtle spermathecal differences (fig. 47); however, the distributions of these two species do not overlap (fig. 1).
DESCRIPTIONS: Male described by Bishop and Crosby (1926) ; female described by Gertsch (1935) .

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 48. Records of
M. comstocki Bishop and Crosby.

Figs. 49–55.
Myrmekiaphila coreyi
, new species , from Thomas Co., Georgia (male) and Citrus Co., Florida (female). 49–51. Male left leg I: retrolateral, prolateral, and ventral (metarsus) views. 52–54. Male left pedipalp: retrolateral, ventral, and prolateral views. 55. Spermathecae.

subSubSection.paragraph: DISTRIBUTION: Widely distributed throughout Arkansas, Louisiana , Okalahoma, and eastern/central Texas (fig. 48).
